intro: Tragia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a deep root system for water absorption. Tragia subsessilis is often found in rocky soils and is part of the Malvaceae family.
